body:
### Describe the bug

PEP-669 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0669/) and its implementation in https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/103083 change the internals of CPython's tracing in Py3.12. We need to adapt. Currently, profiling fails in Py3.12.

Compilation was already fixed in https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/03c498d3142ccee2da258c540e96f12c863159fc (#5450), but that doesn't make the feature work again.

Test failure:

<details>

```
======================================================================
FAIL: pstats_profile_test ()
Doctest: pstats_profile_test
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.12.0-beta.1/x64/lib/python3.12/doctest.py", line 2228, in runTest
    raise self.failureException(self.format_failure(new.getvalue()))
AssertionError: Failed doctest test for pstats_profile_test
  File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 1, in pstats_profile_test

----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 8, in pstats_profile_test
Failed example:
    short_stats['f_def']
Exception raised:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.12.0-beta.1/x64/lib/python3.12/doctest.py", line 1357, in __run

      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[5]>", line 1, in <module>

        ~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^
    KeyError: 'f_def'
----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 10, in pstats_profile_test
Failed example:
    short_stats['f_cdef']

        exec(compile(example.source, filename, "single",
      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[6]>", line 1, in <module>
        short_stats['f_cdef']
        ~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^
    KeyError: 'f_cdef'
----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 12, in pstats_profile_test
Failed example:
    short_stats['f_cpdef']

      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[17]>", line 1, in <module>

        ~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^

----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 46, in pstats_profile_test

Failed example:

Exception raised:

Failed example:
    sorted(callees(s, 'test_profile'))  #doctest: +NORMALIZE_WHITESPACE
Expected:

Failed example:

      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[42]>", line 1, in <module>
        python_stats_dict['python_generator'] == cython_stats_dict['generator']
                                                 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    KeyError: 'generator'
```
</details>

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

_No response_

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

_No response_

### Python version

3.12.0b1

### Cython version

current master (3.0.0b3)

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body: Detail tags and triple backticks need to be separated by a newline for the rendering to not be broken.
Is there a chance that this could be in before the final release of 3.12? Also will this functionality be restored for 0.2.x version?

> Is there a chance that this could be in before the final release of 3.12?

If someone repairs it in time, then yes. Investigations and/or PR is welcome.

Basically, someone has to figure out how tracing can be done in Python 3.12 now. The CPython project broke their C-API, so they probably have a (documented?) idea somewhere how to migrate.


> will this functionality be restored for 0.2.x version?

This is out of scope for future 0.29.x releases. We could add an explicit C warning there, though, when users try to use tracing in Py3.12. You can use Python 3.11 for profiling/tracing with 0.29.x.

Quote from @da-woods in https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5813

Profiling on Py3.12+ is currently broken. Here are my notes from looking into it:

* `PyEval_SetProfile` is now "legacy". It still works, and I believe Cython would still interact correctly with it if it were used. However, the standard library profile modules don't use it.
* The current preferred way is via [`sys.monitoring`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/sys.monitoring.html#module-sys.monitoring), and this is what profile/cProfile do.
* `PyEval_SetProfile` sets up functions using the new "monitoring" approach, however, things that use the new "monitoring" approach don't trigger the old `PyEval_SetProfile` way. Therefore, if we want to interact with all profiling tools we really need to use the new "monitoring" approach.
* I think the right thing to do would be to call [`_Py_call_instrumentation`](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/fa84e5fe0a3bd8e77c33b20867d71ac6bee270f9/Python/instrumentation.c#L1035C1) (or something similar). Unfortunately these are internal symbols so fail at the link stage (even if include the internal headers).
* There doesn't seem to be an easy way to check if profiling is enabled. However, `_Py_call_instrumentation` looks to return very quickly if it isn't, so I think that's OK.
* The linking errors are largely where I got stuck - there doesn't seem to be any accessible way to trigger a profiling event manually.
I created https://github.com/python/cpython/issues/111997 for designing a new signalling C-API in CPython.

My proposal for now is just to remove the test from Python 3.12: https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5815.

I suspect if people really needed to profile Cython+Python 3.12 they could cprofile/profile from Python 3.11 and it'd work (because they'd use the "legacy" method). But I don't think that's something we should provide ourself.

Some more information that I was able to collect:

We probably need to build a [line table](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/main/Objects/locations.md). CPython [has C code for this](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/d67f947c72af8a215db2fd285e5de9b1e671fde1/Python/assemble.c#L190-L444) in `assemble.c`, but we need a Python implementation that runs at translation time _and_ an idea for a reasonable mapping of Cython's code positions to reportable event positions.

The code enum (bits 3-6) is defined here:
https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/d67f947c72af8a215db2fd285e5de9b1e671fde1/Include/cpython/code.h#L378-L389

> This is out of scope for future 0.29.x releases. 

I noticed that 0.29.x releases produce a cpp code that doesn't compile, when `cython: profile=True` directive is set. However,  on Cython 3.x, the code compiles. Given that:

> Profiling on Py3.12+ is currently broken

 what is the current behavior on Cython 3.x when  `cython: profile=True` is present? Is it silently ignored? 
 
 Would it make sense to adjust Cython 0.29  to ignore this directive for Python 3.12 , or 0.29.x family is no longer developed and the workaround  to ignore the profiling directive  won't be back-ported? Thanks.

> what is the current behavior on Cython 3.x when `cython: profile=True` is present? Is it silently ignored?

If I remember right, it doesn't do anything. Not deliberately but because it just invokes the old profiling mechanism, but Python is only listening for the new one.

> Would it make sense to adjust Cython 0.29 to ignore this directive for Python 3.12 , or 0.29.x family is no longer developed and the workaround to ignore the profiling directive won't be back-ported?

0.29.x is "important bug fixes only". My feeling is that this doesn't meet the criteria, but if it were a simple change then we'd consider it.

> if it were a simple change then we'd consider it.

I came up with: https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6125. We could include it if we expect usage of Cython 0.29 on 3.12. 
Does Cython have  a plan to cap an upper bound of allowed  Python minor version for the 0.29 version family?

I've started on an implementation for Py3.13, based on the newly designed monitoring C-API. I'll see how that goes.
https://github.com/python/cpython/issues/111997

@scoder, I see that the issue you linked in your [most recent comment above](https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5470#issuecomment-2056451053) is now closed. Do we know what work remains to fix this? I'd love to be able to profile my .pyx functions with cProfile in Python 3.13, if possible.
This is not going to be changed in Cython 3.0.x any more. 3.1 has a new implementation, so I'll close this ticket.

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: [BUG] Profiling/tracing fails in Py3.12
